snippet: Above the Influence lost millions of dollars in appropriations, but executives of the partnership at Drugfree.org have decided to try to keep the campaign going.
abstract: Advertising column; Above the Influence campaign that was deemed effective in fighting drug and alcohol abuse among American teenagers is seeking a second act after federal government ended its financing; executives of the Partnership at Drugfree.org have decided to try to keep the campaign going by turning to social media.
lead_paragraph: Above the Influence lost millions of dollars in appropriations, but executives of the partnership at Drugfree.org have decided to try to keep the campaign going.

headline.main: Antidrug Campaign, Lacking Federal Funds, Turns to Social Media
headline.print_headline: Antidrug Campaign, Lacking Federal Funds, Turns to Social Media
